Dear C^gftison, Prime Minister of Australia, is flying from Australia to the Middle East and then on to this country, starting in the course of the next few days. We have been asked by him to secure all possible facilities and courtesies for him and his party while en route from the various Administrations through whose territories he will travel, and in particular to secure that requisite censorship action is taken as regards news of his movements. With this in view we have prepared the enclosed draft of a telegram for the India Office to send to the Government of India, and we shall be very grateful if a telegram in the sense of the enclosed can be sent as speedily as possible. The matter is somewhat urgent in view of the time factor involved. Yours sincerely, j. j. sS 1 , M.J. Clauson, Esq. RECt. Fit. •EPt. ||NDIA OFFICE£

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: PZ 347/41 'Visit of Mr. Menzies, Australian Prime Minister, to Middle East & U.K - requesting facilities.'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 4; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located at the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a letter from the Dominions Office to the India Office, with a request to secure facilities for safe passage of Mr Robert Menzies, Prime Minister of Australia, on his journey through British possessions to the United Kingdom, and in particular to secure news censorship of his movements during this time. The file also contains a draft telegram to this effect, which was prepared by the Dominions Office and enclosed with the aforementioned letter, for the India Office to send to the Government of India.
